nl.inl.blacklab.search

Class Searcher

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.inl.blacklab.search.Searcher

  • public class Searcher
extends java.lang.Object
    The main interface into the BlackLab library. The Searcher object is instantiated with an open Lucene IndexReader and accesses that index through special methods. The Searcher object knows how to access the original contents of indexed fields, either because the field is a stored field in the Lucene index, or because it knows where else the content can be found (such as in fixed-length-encoding files, for fast random access). Searcher is thread-safe: a single instance may be shared to perform a number of simultaneous searches.

    • Method Detail

      • getMakeConcordancesFromForwardIndex

        public boolean getMakeConcordancesFromForwardIndex()
        Are we making concordances using the forward index (true) or using the content store (false)? Forward index is more efficient but returns concordances that don't include XML tags.
        Returns:
        true iff we use the forward index for making concordances.

      • concordancesIncludeXmlTags

        @Deprecated
public boolean concordancesIncludeXmlTags()
        Deprecated. always returns true now
        Do our concordances include the original XML tags, or are they stripped out?
        Returns:
        true iff our concordances include XML tags.

      • setMakeConcordancesFromForwardIndex

        public void setMakeConcordancesFromForwardIndex(boolean concordancesFromForwardIndex)
        Do we want to retrieve concordances from the forward index instead of from the content store? This may be more efficient, particularly for small result sets (because it eliminates seek time and decompression time), but concordances won't include XML tags. Also, if there is no punctuation forward index ("punct"), concordances won't include punctuation.
        Parameters:
        concordancesFromForwardIndex - true if we want to use the forward index to make concordances.

      • openForWriting

        public static Searcher openForWriting(java.io.File indexDir,
                      boolean createNewIndex)
                               throws org.apache.lucene.index.CorruptIndexException,
                                      java.io.IOException
        Open an index for writing ("index mode": adding/deleting documents). Note that in index mode, searching operations may not take the latest changes into account. It is wisest to only use index mode for indexing, then close the Searcher and create a regular one for searching.
        Parameters:
        indexDir - the index directory
        createNewIndex - if true, create a new index even if one existed there
        Returns:
        the searcher in index mode
        Throws:
        org.apache.lucene.index.CorruptIndexException
        java.io.IOException

      • warmUpForwardIndices

        public void warmUpForwardIndices()
                          throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        "Warm up" the forward indices by performing a large number of reads on them, getting them into disk cache. Not that this is done automatically in a background thread at startup, so you shouldn't need to call this unless you've specifically switched this behaviour off.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the thread was interrupted during this operation

      • buildAllTermIndices

        public void buildAllTermIndices()
        Builds index for Terms.indexOf() method. This makes sure the first call to Terms.indexOf() in search mode will be fast. Subsequent calls are always fast. (Terms.indexOf() is only used in search mode by HitPropValue.deserialize(), so if you're not sure if you need to call this method in your application, you probably don't. Note that if you're using the automatic warmup, this method is called already and you don't need to call it again manually.

      • getForwardIndex

        public ForwardIndex getForwardIndex(java.lang.String fieldPropName)
        Tries to get the ForwardIndex object for the specified fieldname. Looks for an already-opened forward index first. If none is found, and if we're in "create index" mode, may create a new forward index. Otherwise, looks for an existing forward index and opens that.
        Parameters:
        fieldPropName - the field for which we want the forward index
        Returns:
        the ForwardIndex if found/created, or null otherwise

      • setForwardIndexConcordanceParameters

        public void setForwardIndexConcordanceParameters(java.lang.String wordFI,
                                        java.lang.String punctFI,
                                        java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> attrFI)
        Indicate how to use the forward indices to build concordances.
        Parameters:
        wordFI - FI to use as the text content of the <w/> tags (default "word"; null for no text content)
        punctFI - FI to use as the text content between <w/> tags (default "punct"; null for just a space)
        attrFI - FIs to use as the attributes of the <w/> tags (null for all other FIs)

      • getTerms

        public Terms getTerms(java.lang.String fieldPropName)
        Get the Terms object for the specified field. The Terms object is part of the ForwardIndex module and provides a mapping from term id to term String, and between term id and term sort position. It is used while sorting and grouping hits (by mapping the context term ids to term sort position ids), and later used to display the group name (by mapping the sort position ids back to Strings)
        Parameters:
        fieldPropName - the field for which we want the Terms object
        Returns:
        the Terms object
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if this field does not have a forward index, and hence no Terms object.

      • getTerms

        public Terms getTerms()
        Get the Terms object for the main contents field. The Terms object is part of the ForwardIndex module and provides a mapping from term id to term String, and between term id and term sort position. It is used while sorting and grouping hits (by mapping the context term ids to term sort position ids), and later used to display the group name (by mapping the sort position ids back to Strings)
        Returns:
        the Terms object
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if this field does not have a forward index, and hence no Terms object.

        Parameters:
        b - if true, automatically warm up forward indices in Searcher constructor

      • getWriter

        public org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter getWriter()

      • getIndexDirectory

        public java.io.File getIndexDirectory()

      • delete

        public void delete(org.apache.lucene.search.Query q)
        Deletes documents matching a query from the BlackLab index. This deletes the documents from the Lucene index, the forward indices and the content store(s).
        Parameters:
        q - the query

      • getAnalyzer

        public org.apache.lucene.analysis.Analyzer getAnalyzer()
